channel.title: command injection on dronesec
channel.description: Recent content in command injection on dronesec

item.title: IBM Tealeaf CX (v8 Release 8) Remote OS Command Injection / LFI
item.description: Tealeaf Technologies was purchased by IBM in May of 2012, and is a customer buying analytics application. Essentially, an administrator will configure a Tealeaf server that accepts analytic data from remote servers, which it then generates various models, graphs, reports, etc based on the aggregate of data. Their analytics status/server monitoring application is vulnerable to a fairly trivial OS command injection vulnerability, as well as local file inclusion. This vulnerability was discovered on a PCI engagement against a large retailer; the LFI was used to pull PHP files and hunt for RCE.

item.title: Asus RT56U Remote Command Injection
item.description: After discovering a couple vulnerabilities in the Asus RT56U prior, I decided to check out the latest firmware and hunt around for a few more. I was running 3.0.0.4.342, which happens to be one version behind the latest (3.0.0.4.360), so I did a sweep of both. I enabled telnet on the router and hunted around, which led me to an unlinked page, Main_Analysis_Content.asp. This page hosts a slew of diagnostic tools, including the ability to ping network systems.
